org.rapla.client

Interface ClientExtension


  • public interface ClientExtension
    classes implementing ClientExtension are started automaticaly when a user has successfully login into the Rapla system. A class added as service doesn't need to implement a specific interface and is instanciated automaticaly after client login. You can add a RaplaContext parameter to your constructor to get access to the services of rapla. Generally you don't need to start a client service. It is better to provide functionality through the RaplaClientExtensionPoints
